Fujian Agriculture and Forestry University
福建农林大学
The main campus of Fujian Agriculture
Motto 明德 诚智 博学 创新
Motto in English
 excellent virtue, true wisdom, successful learning, innovation
Type Public
Established 1936
President Lan Siren
Administrative staff
 2300
Students 20000[1]
Location Fuzhou, Fujian,  People's Republic of China
26°5′16″N 119°14′6″E﻿ / ﻿26.08778°N 119.23500°E﻿ / 26.08778; 119.23500Coordinates: 26°5′16″N 119°14′6″E﻿ / ﻿26.08778°N 119.23500°E﻿ / 26.08778; 119.23500

Fujian Agriculture and Forestry University (Chinese: 福建农林大学) is a public university in Jinshan, Fuzhou, Fujian, China.

Fujian Agriculture and Forestry University's library collection contains more than 1.63 million volumes.[2]

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Campus
  • 3 References
  • 4 External links

History[edit]

The university was founded in 1936. It is now known as the Fujian Agriculture and Forestry University is public university focused on the development of agriculture and forestry.

Campus[edit]

The main campus is in the rural part of Fuzhou and most of the institutions are located there.

Apart from its major campuses, the university owns and operates an independent college named Oriental College. Oriental College is located in Mawei, Fuzhou.
